Canberra must probe franchises

8:34AMRobert Gottliebsen

Given Allan Fels’ revelations, it’s time parliament stepped in and investigated allegations of widespread wrongdoing.

    Competition law in cold storage

    12:19PMJohn Durie

    Deadline for the government’s promised draft release has passed, and there’s little chance it will appear during an election campaign.

      AnalysisStorm in a teacup over super

      12:00AMAdam Creighton

      The anti-retrospectivity furore over super changes is largely self-interested bleating dressed up as high principle.

        A turning point for commodities

        12:09PMStephen Bartholomeusz

        BHP and Rio are now the only big miners with the capacity to start investing in meaningful expansion.

        NEWS

        Maurice Blackburn eyes 7-Eleven talks

        5:04PMBen Butler

        The law firm will threaten legal action if Deloitte fails to make an undertaking on sensitive information.

          Sigma flags impact of class action

          3:48PMJohn Conroy

          Sigma Pharmaceuticals says it will be finally putting to bed monies outstanding from the class action against it.

            CrownBet misses NRL deal

            3:48PMSarah-Jane Tasker

            The James Packer-backed wagering group has lost the $60m deal to rival Sportsbet.

              Myer shares extend results rally

              3:34PMDaniel Palmer

              The retail giant’s share price has swelled for a second day as analysts rush to upgrade their forecasts.

                MG hits back on price claims

                3:04PMSue Neales, Ben Butler

                Murray Goulburn has denied board members knew before April’s meeting that processed milk sale targets were not being met.

                  Stocks fall as momentum ebbs

                  2:33PMJohn Conroy

                  The local market has ended in the red, with Telstra and BHP weighing.

                    Apple bets $US1bn on Uber rival

                    1:35PM

                    The strategic investment in China’s homegrown Didi comes as it soars to a $US25bn valuation.

                      ASX progresses CEO search

                      12:50PMJohn Durie

                      The ASX has appointed headhunter Korn Ferry to find a replacement for Elmer Funke Kupper.

                        Stocks swing into the red

                        1:05PMJohn Conroy

                        The Australian sharemarket dipped into negative territory at noon as retail stocks pared early gains and the dollar slid.

                          Data pushes Aussie below US73c

                          12:10PMDaniel Palmer

                          The local unit has tumbled to a 10-week low as lending finance numbers fail to aid sentiment.
